|expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4712 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware=DD-WRT,OpenWrt |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=motorola XXX |default_ssid_regex=^motorola [A-F0-9]{3}$ |default_ip=192.168.10.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=motorola |oui=00:0C:E5 |oui_eth=00:0C:E5 |default_ch= }} [http://broadband.motorola.com/consumers/products/WR850g/downloads/wr850g_userguide_6.1.4.pdf User guide] OEM Gemtek WRTB-108GM (WRTB-108GM_V01) P/N: 518576-001-00 {{TechInfoDepot|Motorola_WR850GP}}
[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Flash_Your_Motorola_WR850G WR850G on the DD-WRT wiki]
[http://wiki.openwrt.org/oldwiki/OpenWrtDocs/Hardware/Motorola/WR850G WR850G on the OpenWrt wiki] The default SSID is '''motorola XXX''' where '''XXX''' is the last three hex digits of the WLAN MAC address (upper case letters). The included power adapter is a '''Leader Electronics''' P/N 503913-004, Model MT20-21120-A00F (12V, 750mA). ID/OD/Len measurements are approximate. {{WiFiCert|W002472|08/06/2004}} :There is an additional certification of W002797 (09/23/2004) for this device. It notes no change in capabilities aside from Enterprise WPA support (no WPA2 support noted).
